Start.Content: Welcome to the AI Tutorial. This tutorial will teach you about the AI functionality in StarMade and how to use it.

StateA.Content: StarMade offers two modes for AI at this moment: Ship and Turret. More functions will be added.

StateB.Content:
To build an AI controlled ship, you have to place down an AI module on it.
A structure can only have ONE AI Module, so make sure it's protected well.

StateC.Content:
You can change the settings of the AI module by pressing '$ACTIVATE' on it.
A panel with all the options will appear.

StateD.Content:
The best way to operate AI is to be in a faction, as then the AI knows exactly who your enemies are.
They function without a faction too.

StateE.Content: Depending on what you want to use it for, set your AI to 'ship' or 'turret'. Turrets will not use their thrusters.

StateF.Content: Next, you can set their behaviour. Aim at 'Any' means it will attack any enemy in range. Aim at 'Selected Target' is only relevant for turrets and means that those will attack the targeted entity, the pilot of the mother ship selects an entity with '$SELECT_LOOK_ENTITY'

StateG.Content: To activate the AI, you have to tick off 'Activate'. Re-entering that ship core will disable the AI!

StateH.Content:
You can also do it from the comfort of your ship by opening the structure panel. Press $STRUCTURE_PANEL and select the docked entity you want to turn on or off.
You can also turn on/off all docked entities at once in the structure panel.

End.Content: This concludes the AI Tutorial. Thanks for reading, and thanks for playing StarMade!
